attributes.action: Consider the route for the new High SpeedRail 2 (HS2)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The route would leave London via the Ruislip area, making use of an existing rail corridor.

It would then cross the Chilterns in the Aylesbury direction, partly in tunnel before following the route of the A413 past Wendover.

HS2 Ltd’s report presents a number of options for this part of the journey, "each of which presents different engineering and sustainability challenges with associated costs". 

Aylesbury MP David Lidington said: "I think this is going to be devastating to a lot of people in my constituency.

"The chief question I will be asking is what the environmental benefit to the country that can justify the environmental harm done to people in Aylesbury who will be living very close to the land, and the people in the Chilterns, in places like Wendover and Great Missenden."

The MP said his initial concerns were about noise and visual intrusion in Aylesbury and Stoke Mandeville, the damage to the landscape in the Chilterns, and the impact on house values along the route.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
